: : Rodimus Prime : :
Rodimus Prime: After a infant drinks like she did, you have to burp them. This prevents any stomcach aches or anything like that. I saw Carly and Spike, two of the Autobots human allies on Earth, do this to their son Daniel when he was young.
Rodimus liked the memories that were coming to him. It was nice when he had been stationed at Autobot City by Kup, in the mid 1990's. He, or rather Hot Rod, loved giveing Kup a hardtime back then. He idolized Optimus. And he found friends in Spike, Carly, Daniel, Chip and Sparkplug. He had also met Arcee then...
Rodimus forced himself from any thoughts of Arcee for two reasons. One: he didn't want to become angry again thinking of how she became a Predacon and was killed escaping the very base he was in. Two: he had a family now. Arcee and anything that was between them was in the past, the far past.
To reassure himself, Rodimus gazed at his daughter, then too Nightlight. How lovely she was and how lucky he was to have met her. How grate it was to, despite being a millitary commander, finally have a family.
 "airly2000 <airly2002@...>" <airly2002@...> wrote:Elita/Nightlight:

"Why're you doing that ROdimus?"said couriously 'cause she never 
have seen somoeone started to Burp a baby.

The baby burped and yawed, she nuzzled against her dad, and started 
to fell sleep.

<P align=center><STRONG>: : Rodimus Prime : :</STRONG>
<P align=center><STRONG>Rodimus Prime: </STRONG>After a infant drinks like she did, you have to burp them. This prevents any stomcach aches or anything like that. I saw Carly and Spike, two of the Autobots human allies on Earth, do this to their son Daniel when he was young.
<P align=center>Rodimus liked the memories that were coming to him. It was nice when he had been stationed at Autobot City by Kup, in the mid 1990's. He, or rather Hot Rod, loved giveing Kup a hardtime back then. He idolized Optimus. And he found friends in Spike, Carly, Daniel, Chip and Sparkplug. He had also met Arcee then...
<P align=center>Rodimus forced himself from any thoughts of Arcee for two reasons. One: he didn't want to become angry again thinking of how she became a Predacon and was killed escaping the very base he was in. Two: he had a family now. Arcee and anything that was between them was in the past, the far past.
<P align=center>To reassure himself, Rodimus gazed at his daughter, then too Nightlight. How lovely she was and how lucky he was to have met her. How grate it was to, despite being a millitary commander, finally have a family.
<P> <B><I>"airly2000 <airly2002@...>" <airly2002@...></I></B> wrote:
